titulo: OER-UCLouvain: La boîte trouée
descripcion: La ressource consiste en une fiche pédagogique portant sur une expérience de sous-discipline. Celle-ci propose des informations pratiques pour l'enseignant ainsi qu'une explication pédagogique de l'expérience. La ressource contient également une vidéo de l'expérience.

titulo: Crystallizing Minerals from Aqueous Solutions
descripcion: Students dissolve selected salts and other compounds in water, let the water evaporate for about three weeks, and examine the crystals that grow. Students then draw crystal shapes and discuss the experiment. Discussion can include why and how crystals grow from solutions, why some minerals dissolve well and others do not, concepts of symmetry, and crystal systems and point groups.

titulo: Porosity and Permeability
descripcion: The students are exposed to a brief (approx. 5 minute) introduction/presentation on aquifers and groundwater including their geographical context, structure, and vocabulary.

titulo: IODP 310: Coral Reef off Tahiti
descripcion: In this activity, students will make observations about the core that was collected on IODP expedition 310.

titulo: Aquifers in outcrop
descripcion: Students describe the hydrogeologic properties of different sedimentary and volcanic rocks.

titulo: Pump Test
descripcion: Students run a pump test and interpret the results as drawdown curves and hydraulic conductivity measurements.

titulo: Petrology and Geochemistry of the Ongoing Pu'u 'Ō'ō Eruption of Kīlauea Volcano, Hawai'i (1983-2009)
descripcion: Pre-lab material provides background on the Hawaiian hotspot and the current eruption utilizing maps, diagrams, information, photographs, and video footage of the Pu'u 'Ō'ō-Kupaianaha eruption with written questions that test understanding of this material.

titulo: Rates of Change and Deep Time in the Middle Grades Classroom
descripcion: The nature and scientific measurement of geological and cosmological time are among the most misunderstood and difficult to teach concepts in all of K-12 science education. To address this issue, a multi-disciplinary team of geologists, astronomers and education professionals at Western Kentucky University developed a series of professional development workshops for pre- and in-service middle grades teachers. The goals of those workshops were to 1) to develop teacher's content understanding of rates of change and the ages of the earth and universe; and 2) to provide teachers with materials, activities and teaching strategies to help them more effectively educate students about rates of change and the concepts of deep time. Two four-day workshops were held, with each workshop divided into two two-day sessions. Each workshop day consisted of a blend of in-depth content discussions, hands-on activities, and classroom implementation forums. The teachers were provided with all the materials necessary to implement the lessons learned during the workshops as well as publications pertaining to deep time and evolution. Teachers were assessed prior to and immediately after each workshop day and were required to submit a classroom implementation plan as part of their involvement in the workshops.

titulo: Using Dendrochronology to Determine the Age and Past Environments of the Black Forest Region, Colorado, USA
descripcion: The use of dendrochronology in determining the geologic history of a location. The development of an understanding how tree growth can indicate the relationships between climate, geomorphology, ecology and archeology.

titulo: Discovering the Principles of Relative Age Determination â a Think-Pair-Share In-Class Activity
descripcion: In this in-class activity, students are challenged to identify rock units and geologic features and determine the relative ages of these features without prior instruction in the classical methods of relative age determination.

titulo: Activity Option 2.2 - Rare Earth Elements: Critical Elements of the Future
descripcion: This activity is based on the global supply and demand relationships of rare earth elements (REE). Students will work in small groups to analyze China's role in global REE production and supply, and how REE production, supply, and demand control REE price.

titulo: Open Science: Wie sich die Wissenschaft öffnet
descripcion: During the last years, many scientific disciplines have changed. There have been new journals, methods, initiatives, societies, structures, and many more. Researchers are calling these changes a crisis, revolution, a renaissance, or a reform. Together, these changes have led to a greater degree of openness and transparency and have changed the academic system. In this German textbook, I discuss the concept of openness, the origins of change, and the many facets of openness with an emphasis on the academic system, scientific methods, theories, and epistemological arguments. Examples and developments are primarily from the social sciences, particularly psychology.

titulo: The UKRN Open Research Programme Progress And Plans
descripcion: Minutes 7-16 of this seminar outline the plans for incorporating EDI into ORP workstreams.

titulo: Elaboración de trabajos académicos
descripcion: En este tema revisaremos los principales elementos y los criterios básicos para la presentación de trabajos escritos y de un proyecto de investigación; así como los conceptos de estado del arte y aparato crítico.

titulo: Undermind.ai (Product Review)
descripcion: This is a product review of an AI-powered tool by a health sciences librarian.

titulo: Link to Reproducibility By Design OSF repository
descripcion: Here you can find materials and resources relating to Reproducibility by Design (Uni of Bristol) training courses. A novel framework to provide academic researchers with practical approaches to improving aspects of their research, with a focus on health and life sciences research

titulo: Transparency Now! Decision Guidance for GenAI in Libraries and Classrooms
descripcion: GenAI presents new problems that potentially hide the truth regarding the authorship and provenance of creative works. Administrators in many areas of the public and private sectors are struggling with ways to address genAI use, ranging from banning to ignoring to promoting AI use. This session will discuss what actions individuals can take in order to ensure appropriate transparency in the creation of genAI content.

titulo: AI in Academic Libraries, Part One: Concerns and Commodification
descripcion: Academic Library Workers in Conversation is a C&RL News series focused on elevating the everyday conversations of library professionals. The wisdom of the watercooler has long been heralded, but this series hopes to go further by minimizing barriers to traditional publishing with an accessible format. Each of the topics in the series were proposed by the authors and they were given space to explore. This conversation is the first of two parts that will discuss generative AI and the many concerns that the authors already see playing out in their organizations.

titulo: Building Better Research Software: Summary and Setup
descripcion: This short course teaches tools and practices for producing and sharing quality, sustainable and FAIR (Findable, Accessible, Interoperable and Reusable) research software to support open and reproducible research. The course can be delivered over 2 full or 4 half days.

titulo: University of Southampton Open Access Policy
descripcion: This policy applies to all researchers at University of Southampton, which means any person publishing and/or disseminating research outputs which shall include but not be limited to employees, workers, visiting researchers, postgraduate research students.

titulo: Responsible use of research metrics
descripcion: In January 2018, on the recommendation of Research Committee, Keele University signed the San Francisco Declaration on Research Assessment (DoRA). DoRA is a set of recommendations designed to ensure that “…the quality and impact of scientific outputs…is measured accurately and evaluated wisely.” To date, signatories include seven other Russell Group universities, including: Imperial College London, University of Manchester and UCL.

titulo: Governance, integrity and ethics - The Research Governance Toolkit
descripcion: Research at Keele University publishes policies available to all researchers including:

titulo: Open Learning Multimedia
descripcion: The Open Learning Multimedia Project is a go-to resource for TRU Open Learning course developers who want to enhance their course design using evidence-based multimedia strategies. Created under the leadership of Dr. Verena Roberts with support from TRU research students and developers, the site features clear, practical guides based on The Cambridge Handbook of Multimedia Learning (2021), an annotated bibliography of recent multimedia research, and links to existing TRU media tools. Organized by WordPress tags, it's easy to navigate by topic, making it simple for instructors to explore discipline-specific examples, connect ideas, and apply multimedia techniques in online course development.

titulo: Building Data Literacy in 2SLGBTQ+ Social Work Education – Simple Book Publishing
descripcion: This Open Educational Resource (OER) contains four chapters that integrate 2SLGBTQ+ content into social work education through the lens of critical data literacy. It is designed to equip social work educators in Canadian Schools of Social Work with the knowledge and tools to guide students in effectively engaging with secondary, quantitative Canadian data as evidence for research, practice, and advocacy with 2SLGBTQ+ communities.

titulo: ORP Evaluation Protocol
descripcion: This document outlines the methodology to be used for evaluating the UKRN Open Research Programme (ORP).

titulo: FAIR Data Assessment Tools
descripcion: Implementation of the FAIR Principles: Effective data management and curation is increasingly important in the research landscape, and planning for FAIR data from a project’s outset is crucial. Yet the FAIR principles are often misunderstood or conflated with open data practices.This Train-the-Trainer course clarified how Open Research (OR) practices and the FAIR principles interconnected, showing their mutual benefits. It included sections on pedagogy to help participants create local training sessions tailored to their communities.Designed for those involved in data curation and management across the research lifecycle, the course supported participants in helping others make their outputs FAIR. They explored a representative session linking OR practices to FAIR outcomes, illustrating their relevance and importance.

titulo: How the data protection principles apply to research
descripcion: This post will help you better understand UK data protection law in a research context. Read through the post or use the hyperlinks to use as a reference guide.

titulo: University of Surrey Library - Résumé for Researchers and Innovation (R4RI)-like narrative CVs
descripcion: The University of Surrey (R4RI)-like narrative CV webpage describes the Résumé for Researchers and Innovation (R4RI) / narrative CV approach as a way to move beyond traditional, metrics-heavy CVs by encouraging researchers to tell a more holistic story of their contributions. Instead of just listing publications and grants, it prompts you to reflect on multiple areas of your work: how you generate new knowledge or tools; how you nurture others and build collaborations; how you contribute to the research community; and how your work impacts society. It also gives space for personal context (career breaks, secondments, etc.) so that evaluation can be fairer and more inclusive.

titulo: Habilidades Clave para los Trabajos del Futuro
descripcion: ¿Estás listo para el futuro del trabajo?La globalización están reescribiendo las reglas. Las empresas que llegan a México buscan algo más que títulos. ¿Sabes cuáles son las tres habilidades esenciales que te harán irremplazable en la próxima década?Descubre por qué la adaptabilidad es tu nuevo salario, cómo el aprendizaje continuo te salvará de la obsolescencia y por qué el pensamiento crítico es tu arma secreta para la innovación.El éxito no es técnico, es estratégico. Prepárate para destacar.

titulo: Sharing Platform Project Document
descripcion: The Project Initiation Document (PID) is a collection of documents that defines the scope and approach of the project. The PID is created in the Initiation and Planning phase of the project lifecycle.

titulo: Economic profit for a monopoly
descripcion: Learn about how to represent a monopoly market graphically in this video. Topics covered include the profit-maximizing quantity, pricing decisions, and deadweight loss associated with monopolies.

titulo: Saberes Indígenas: Ancestralidade, tradição e educação com a natureza
descripcion: O presente trabalho originou-se como produto de dissertação de mestrado envolvendo educadoras não indígenas e indígena. Trata-se de um Protocolo de apontamentos para a realização de práticas educativas interculturais com a proposta principal de uma Roda de Conversa com a temática: "Sabedorias Tradicionais com a Natureza". O Protocolo de apontamento visa auxiliar educadores a planejarem ações interculturais respeitosas e comprometidas com o protagonismo e a valorização dos indígenas nos trabalhos interculturais, atendendo e efetivando o trato da lei 11.645 nas escolas e outros espaços educacionais.

titulo: Degrees of Freedom in Planning, Running, Analyzing, and Reporting Psychological Studies: A Checklist to Avoid p-Hacking
descripcion: The designing, collecting, analyzing, and reporting of psychological studies entail many choices that are often arbitrary. The opportunistic use of these so-called researcher degrees of freedom aimed at obtaining statistically significant results is problematic because it enhances the chances of false positive results and may inflate effect size estimates. In this review article, we present an extensive list of 34 degrees of freedom that researchers have in formulating hypotheses, and in designing, running, analyzing, and reporting of psychological research. The list can be used in research methods education, and as a checklist to assess the quality of preregistrations and to determine the potential for bias due to (arbitrary) choices in unregistered studies.

titulo: Internal conceptual replications do not increase independent replication success
descripcion: Recently, many psychological effects have been surprisingly difficult to reproduce. This article asks why, and investigates whether conceptually replicating an effect in the original publication is related to the success of independent, direct replications. Two prominent accounts of low reproducibility make different predictions in this respect. One account suggests that psychological phenomena are dependent on unknown contexts that are not reproduced in independent replication attempts. By this account, internal replications indicate that a finding is more robust and, thus, that it is easier to independently replicate it. An alternative account suggests that researchers employ questionable research practices (QRPs), which increase false positive rates. By this account, the success of internal replications may just be the result of QRPs and, thus, internal replications are not predictive of independent replication success. The data of a large reproducibility project support the QRP account: replicating an effect in the original publication is not related to independent replication success. Additional analyses reveal that internally replicated and internally unreplicated effects are not very different in terms of variables associated with replication success. Moreover, social psychological effects in particular appear to lack any benefit from internal replications. Overall, these results indicate that, in this dataset at least, the influence of QRPs is at the heart of failures to replicate psychological findings, especially in social psychology. Variable, unknown contexts appear to play only a relatively minor role. I recommend practical solutions for how QRPs can be avoided.

titulo: The Eighth Amendment
descripcion: A deep dive into the Eighth Amendment, which protects citizens from excessive fines and cruel and unusual punishment. In this video, Kim discusses the Eighth Amendment with scholars John Bessler and John Stinneford.

titulo: Judicial activism and judicial restraint
descripcion: Using Baker v. Carr to discuss judicial activism versus judicial restraint.

titulo: Earmarks, pork barrel projects and logrolling
descripcion: Earmarks, pork barrel projects and logrolling.

titulo: Senate checks on presidential appointments
descripcion: An overview of Senate checks on presidential appointments.

titulo: Representatives as delegates, trustees, and politicos
descripcion: Classifying different roles for members of Congress.

titulo: Hyperinflation
descripcion: Basic of hyperinflation. Weimar Germany, Hungarian Pengo and Zimbabwean Dollar. Created by Sal Khan.

titulo: Overview of fractional reserve banking
descripcion: Big picture of how money enters circulation and how lending can increase the money supply. Created by Sal Khan.

titulo: Fiscal and monetary policy in parallel
descripcion: In previous lessons we've learned how expansionary monetary policy and expansionary fiscal policy can be used to mitigate a recession, but they don't have to be used in isolation from each other. Often there is simultaneous use of fiscal and monetary policy. Learn what happens when they are used at the same time in this video.

titulo: Relation between nominal and real returns and inflation
descripcion: Relation between nominal and real returns and inflation. Created by Sal Khan.

titulo: Monetary policy tools
descripcion: Monetary policy is the use of the money supply to affect key macroeconomic variables, such as real GDP. This video focuses on how a central bank can use open market operations and reserve requirements to enact monetary policy to close output gaps.

titulo: Equilibrium nominal interest rates in the money market
descripcion: How are nominal real interest rates determined? In the money market! Learn about the money market in this video.

titulo: Money supply and demand impacting interest rates
descripcion: Examples showing how various factors can affect interest rates. Created by Sal Khan.

titulo: Calculating change in spending or taxes to close output gaps
descripcion: Recall that the tax multiplier and expenditure multiplier magnify the effect of any change in spending or taxes. In this video, we use that fact to calculate the amount of spending or tax change necessary to close output gaps.

titulo: Gini Coefficient and Lorenz Curve
descripcion: Learn how the Gini coefficient can be used to interpret income inequality in this video.

titulo: Balloon payment mortgage
descripcion: Explore the mechanics of balloon payment mortgages in this video, including how they work and in what situation a balloon payment loan might be advantageous and when it might work against you.

titulo: Monopsony employers and minimum wages
descripcion: We've learned in previous lessons that a price control decreases quantity and efficiency, but is that always the case? Learn about the surprising effect of a minimum wage on a monopsonistic labor market in this video.
